intro: Seguiera nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower seguíra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Seguiera nudiflora thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils along streambanks.
